    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static AccountStore getInstance(android.content.Context context)
        This object will be using a Reference to the application context via getApplicationContext() NOT the Activity context Recommended to be initialized at the application startup or by initializing in your own class extending application

        Don't forget to set the username and password on first init

        Parameters:
        context - It is used only the first time of the singleton initialization. Its reference is stored so the singleton is alive during the application lifecycle.
        Returns:

      • addAccount

        public android.os.Bundle addAccount(android.app.Activity activity,
                           String username,
                           String password)
        Usage: 
         Bundle b = addAccount(uInfo.getEmail(), uInfo.getApiKey());
 if (b != null) {
        setAccountAuthenticatorResult(b);
 }
        Use it with an extended AccountAuthenticatorActivity to provide a way to add an account via the accounts and sync screen. Using account requires manifest permissions: 
          uses-permission android:name="android.permission.GET_ACCOUNTS"
  uses-permission android:name="android.permission.MANAGE_ACCOUNTS"
  uses-permission android:name="android.permission.AUTHENTICATE_ACCOUNTS"
        Parameters:
        context -
        username - The account username
        password - the app token used to access the api's
        Returns:
        an Authentication Bundle

      • saveApiKey

        public boolean saveApiKey(String apiKey,
                 android.content.Context context)
        Use as an alternative for saving the token to accounts (Note that using the account manager is a preferred and safer method)
        Parameters:
        apiKey - the token acquired from chute auth
        context -
        Returns:
        if the save was successful

      • startAuthenticationActivity

        public void startAuthenticationActivity(android.app.Activity activity,
                               AuthenticationFactory.AccountType accountType,
                               String scope,
                               String redirectUri,
                               String clientId,
                               String clientSecret)

        Use AUTHENTICATION_REQUEST_CODE inside the onActivityResult to check the request code

        Use Activity.RESULT_OK for the result code if the auth was successful 

          For errors use the following constants for the result code 
 Use GCAuthenticationActivity#CODE_HTTP_EXCEPTION} - For connection problems
 Use GCAuthenticationActivity#CODE_HTTP_ERROR} - For server issues, see logcat for detailed error
 Use GCAuthenticationActivity#CODE_PARSER_EXCEPTION} - For result parsing errors, see logcat for details
        Parameters:
        activity -
        accountType -
        scope -
        redirectUri -
        clientId -
        clientSecret -
